description: DOM debugging allows setting breakpoints on particular DOM operations and events. JavaScript execution will stop on these operations as if there was a regular breakpoint set.

commands.name: setDOMBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular operation with DOM.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to set breakpoint on.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the operation to stop upon.

commands.name: removeDOMBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes DOM breakpoint that was set using setDOMBreakpoint.

parameters.name: nodeId
parameters.description: Identifier of the node to remove breakpoint from.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of the breakpoint to remove.

commands.name: setEventListenerBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular DOM event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: DOM Event name to stop on (any DOM event will do).

commands.name: removeEventListenerBreakpoint
commands.description: Removes breakpoint on particular DOM event.

commands.name: setInstrumentationBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular native event.

commands.name: removeInstrumentationBreakpoint
commands.description: Sets breakpoint on particular native event.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring or regular expression. All XHRs having this substring in the URL will get stopped upon. An empty string will pause on all XHRs.

parameters.name: isRegex
parameters.description: Whether the URL string is a regular expression.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Resource URL substring. An empty string will stop pausing on all XHRs.
